channel.title: python on David Lilien
channel.description: Recent content in python on David Lilien

item.title: Radar processing
item.description: I’ve been doing some work to bring the St. Olaf deep radar processor (StODeep) up into this decade. I’ve had some time twiddling my thumbs while running ice-flow models, and I’ve been doing the work of migrating StODeep as I wait for the model runs. I’m not a fan of Matlab, so I’ve migrated things to Python. A bit of background The St. Olaf Deep radar processor has a long history that I don’t fully know.

item.title: Python Brownbag
item.description: I’m giving a short seminar on python for matlab users this Friday. I plan to give a short presentation on why grad students in Earth and Space Sciences might want to switch from Matlab, followed by prepared demos where people can follow along. I’ll also introduce git, since I think it is probably more important for productivity than the matlab/python choice. Hopefully I’ll have a few open-source converts by the end of the week!
